availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton P. Buster (Monticello, Kentucky, farmer and judge.)

body.p: Monticello, Kentucky, farmer and judge. Kentucky native. Farmer in Wayne County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Louisa L. Parker Buster in Wayne County, Kentucky on November 5, 1846. Father of William Buster, Kate Buster, Sophia Buster, Charles Buster, and John Buster. Judge in Monticello, Kentucky in 1863. Owned three enslaved people in Wayne County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, Division 1, p. 284A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, p. 236.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne, p. 2.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000591550.
Find A Grave, "Milton P. Buster (1824-1864)," Memorial #93627948, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93627948 (accessed January 6, 2020).
